example[1]: He is a pretty awful driver.
example[3]: The last six months have been awful for her.
example[4]: I’ve stopped believing most of what he says. Isn’t that awful?
example[5]: I’m sure Suzy is dead but the awful thing is not knowing how it happened.
definition[1]: used to emphasize how much or how good, bad etc something is
example[6]: An awful lot of people  (=a large number of people) died in the war.
example[7]: He made me feel an awful fool.
definition[2]: making you feel great respect or fear
explanation[0]: Awful is not used with ‘very’ You say
example[8]: It was a really awful experience
bad_example[0]: It was a very awful experience
example[9]: That kid’s awful cute, with her red curls.
